bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, June 18, 1900

div1.p: Lazear reports that his real estate agent has rented his house in Baltimore. He has been running the officers' mess.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, June 18, 1900
div1.p:
No letter has
come from you but I
think it has been
nearly a week since
I wrote. I hope your
hot weather did not
keep up.

Our weather has not
been so pleasant lately.
More rain and somewhat
hotter without our
nice breezes. Ninety-one
however has been the
highest temperature.

Mabel is very much
pleased with Annisquam.
And I have no doubt
you will enjoy it too.

I heard from Herron's
today that they had
rented the Dennistan
Ave. house for $35 a
month from June 1st.
It is quite a relief to
know that. Houses
to rent are a very
treacherous property as
they may cut ones income
down very seriously
by happening to stay
vacant.

I have been pretty busy
lately which is agreable of course
but it makes one wish for
a cooler climate. We have
a nice shower bath and that
is a great comfort. It is made
good use of just now.

In addition to my other duties
I have been running the officers
mess this month and unfortunately
a change of cooks gave me considerable
bother. I can sympathize with
housekeepers.

I hope I shall hear from you
soon-
